plan.reason: Neo routing must be replaced with CF approuter configuration. Routes and destinations need to be migrated to xs-app.json and managed approuter.
UI5 app manifest must be reviewed for CF compatibility. DataSources and destinations need to be mapped to CF destinations. Ensure 'uri' points to a destination in CF and not a direct backend path.
Entry point for UI5 app. Needs to be placed in HTML5 Application Repository for CF. Ensure resource paths and bootstrap are compatible with CF deployment.
Main UI5 component logic. Should be copied to CF webapp as is unless Neo-specific APIs are detected.
UI5 preload bundle for performance. Should be regenerated in CF build pipeline, but can be copied for initial migration.
Debug version of main component. Not required for production, but can be copied for development/testing.
Contains UI5 controller logic. Should be copied to CF webapp unless Neo-specific APIs are detected.
Custom styles for UI5 app. Should be copied to CF webapp.
Internationalization resources. Should be copied to CF webapp.
OData metadata and mock data for local testing. Should be copied for development, but not required in production.
UI5 model logic and data. Should be copied to CF webapp.
App resources and version info. Should be copied to CF webapp.
UI5 XML views and fragments. Should be copied to CF webapp.
Unit and integration tests. Should be copied to CF webapp for continued test coverage.
Code validation results. Useful for migration QA but not required in production.
Bundled manifest and i18n for UI5. Should be regenerated in CF build pipeline, but can be copied for initial migration.
Migration plan artifact. Not part of runtime app, but useful for migration tracking.
Resource manifest for build or deployment. Should be reviewed for CF compatibility.
Sample or mock data for development/testing. Should be copied for development, but not required in production.
UI5 cachebuster info. Should be regenerated in CF build pipeline, but can be copied for initial migration.
Gathered file list artifact. Not part of runtime app, but useful for migration tracking.
